abstract: The early success of Zoho suggests there will be promising openings for innovative upstarts even in markets like online productivity applications, alongside giants like Google and Microsoft.
snippet: The early success of Zoho suggests there will be promising openings for innovative upstarts even in markets like online productivity applications, alongside giants like Google and Microsoft.
lead_paragraph: Life as a small, private company offering online word processors, spreadsheets and e-mail — just like the mighty Google — would seem perilous indeed.

abstract: A coalition that includes Amazon, Microsoft and Yahoo explains its arguments against the settlement.
snippet: A coalition that includes Amazon, Microsoft and Yahoo explains its arguments against the settlement.
lead_paragraph: Last week, we reported that Amazon, Microsoft and Yahoo were joining a new coalition of individuals, companies, libraries and nonprofit groups that are opposing the far-reaching settlement of a lawsuit between Google and groups representing publishers and authors. Representatives of the coalition, which calls itself the Open Book Alliance, said they were concerned about the privacy and antitrust implications of the settlement but gave few details beyond that.

headline.main: Group Lays Out Arguments Against Google Books Deal
